meanings.definition: The quality or state of being globular or spherical in shape.
meanings.sent1: The globosity of the ball made it perfect for rolling.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the globosity of the planet in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The globosity of the balloon made it float effortlessly in the air.
meanings.sent4: The globosity of the moon in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The globosity of the crystal ball reflected the light beautifully.

meanings.definition: The roundness or fullness of a three-dimensional object.
meanings.sent1: The cake's globosity made it look delicious and inviting.
meanings.sent2: The globosity of the vase gave it a classic and elegant appearance.
meanings.sent3: The globosity of the clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The globosity of the basketball made it bounce in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The globosity of the apple made it a perfect snack for the road trip.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is shaped like a globe.
meanings.sent1: The globosity of the Earth is evident when viewed from space.
meanings.sent2: The map failed to capture the true globosity of the planet.
meanings.sent3: The globosity of the snowball grew as it rolled down the hill.
meanings.sent4: The globosity of the crystal ornament sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The globosity of the marble statue made it seem lifelike.
